title: NEED HELP SOMEONE!?
body: My client keeps on freezing in game for some reason. I do not know if Avast is linked with this but I do not know what to do, every 5 seconds is make a durrrrrrrr sound and its normal again, then it repeats itself. Does anyone know how to fix this? Thanks

replies.body:
Hey!

I had a talk with some of the forums Wrenchmen, specifically **SephirothSG**, and here's what he thinks:

+ It's likely your issue is a graphics card problem. Your _"every 5 seconds is make a durrrrrrrr sound"_ seems to indicate this. 

 A quick graphics card driver update should do the trick. Player support has a really helpful walk-through about this, I recommend you check it out.

 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8jSQWa0cRVY

If that doesn't work, then try all the other stuff in the video and look through the rest of the troubleshooting tips [here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes).

**SephirothSG** will be here in a bit if none of that works. It's just that he has IRL commitments and we want to get you back on the Rift as soon as possible :)
How do i check for updates on my graphics card? is it all in the video?
Yes, that video covers everything you need to know :)

Hey i need help on one thing! I went to dxdiag and my graphics card is geforce GT 640 and the date under drivers says 26/2/2013, can you link me the latest for this graphics card and after I download the latest what do i do from there is it ready to go?

Here is the latest version of the drivers for your card. Please only download the one relevant to your OS.

[Windows Vista,7,8,8.1 64 bit](http://us.download.nvidia.com/Windows/361.75/361.75-desktop-win8-win7-winvista-64bit-international-whql.exe)
[Windows Vista,7,8,8.1 32 bit](http://us.download.nvidia.com/Windows/361.75/361.75-desktop-win8-win7-winvista-32bit-international-whql.exe)
[Windows 10 64 bit](http://us.download.nvidia.com/Windows/361.75/361.75-desktop-win10-64bit-international-whql.exe)
[Windows 10 32 bit](http://us.download.nvidia.com/Windows/361.75/361.75-desktop-win10-32bit-international-whql.exe)

After downloading the appropriate driver you should just be able to run the file and install it with no problems.
How did you find it? can you run through the process so i know for next time? Thanks so much! And what happens if it makes it worse? do i roll back the driver or just do a system restore instead?

The video above describes how to locate the latest drivers for your GPU, or you can visit [this page](http://www.geforce.com/drivers).

Alternatively as you have a nvidia card you may download [GeForce Experience](http://www.geforce.com/geforce-experience) to be notified when driver updates are available.

I highly doubt that updating your drivers will cause you more problems, however if it does, rollback the driver or restore from a system restore point.

Hey man I think its the computer that keeps freezing, I don't know what to do anymore? i have re-downloaded league and updated the latest graphics card drivers. My computer is only a year old and is fast, it has never frozen on me. What do i do?
Do you experience this type of freezing in any other games?

No, I checked ram and that is fine, only happens on league. Could it be windows update? because windows 10 kept popping up there and i clicked on show available updates and there were 2 important and 8 optional. Could that be the problem?
I didn't mention anything about your RAM, I would recommend keeping Windows up to date, yes.

I went into dxdiag, checked the date and it was 3 years old without updating! I just finished the download and my screen went black and I panicked but I just waited it out because i know it was doing its thing, i think its finally fixed thanks so much! 3 years old -_- let that sink in
Sounds like a problem with hardware. I once had a similar occurrence while playing csgo, and updating my BIOS fixed the problem. Might be worth a try
How do I do that? Im positive it is league playing up
I did that too before stumbling upon the thread that helped me. Unfortunately I had to re-install everything, luckily it didn't take too long though. Hope I helped!

I didn't have this exact problem but AVAST was the problem for me. I used the following steps (taken from another thread) which helped me.

* Open AVAST.
* Click on Scan for viruses
* Look down the bottom, and click on Virus Chest
* Find LOL.launcher.exe
* Right click on it and select "restore and add to exclusions"
* Close AVAST and it should be working (if this is your problem).

If this isn't the case then you're best to send off a support ticket to Riot or try Googling some things.
Good luck!
Thanks man! I'll try it, if not I will re-install it.
